title: World Cup 2026 qualifying: playoffs draw – live
summary: Luke McLaughlin provides rolling updates on the draw for the March qualifying playoffs. The Republic of Ireland, Wales, and Northern Ireland will discover their upcoming matchups. Stay tuned for live updates on their fates in the qualifiers.

title: Cop30 live: ‘We need to think about how to live without fossil fuels’ Brazilian president Lula tells summit
summary: Brazil's president emphasized the importance of reducing emissions during discussions of climate goals, highlighting the urgency of addressing environmental issues. This statement comes as Turkey prepares to host the next climate summit in the upcoming year. The focus remains on collaborative international efforts to combat climate change effectively.

title: The two extraordinary young activists making me feel optimistic at Cop30
summary: Today's newsletter acknowledges valid criticisms of climate summits but emphasizes that they attract intelligent and dedicated individuals who are committed to combating the climate crisis. The discourse among participants reflects a strong passion for environmental issues. Ultimately, these gatherings play a crucial role in addressing the challenges posed by climate change.

title: Justice department has 30 days to release all Epstein files after Trump signs bill – US politics live
summary: Donald Trump criticized Democrats while attempting to redefine the narrative about his associations with the late Jeffrey Epstein, a convicted sex offender. He is positioning himself as a victim of political attacks related to these connections. Trump's comments come as he faces ongoing scrutiny over his ties to Epstein.

title: French authorities look into Holocaust denial posts from Elon Musk’s Grok AI
summary: An AI chatbot controversially suggested that the gas chambers at Auschwitz-Birkenau were intended for disinfection rather than mass executions. This statement sparked outrage and debate over historical revisionism and the role of AI in disseminating information. The incident highlights ongoing sensitivities surrounding Holocaust discussions and the potential for misinformation through technology.
